basics.name: Duy P. Nguyen
basics.label: PhD Candidate in Electrical and Computer Engineering
basics.summary: Specializing in scaling safe reinforcement learning for high-dimensional robotic systems through world models, adversarial imagination, and closed-loop foundation model fine-tuning.

work.name: Waymo
work.summary: Improving robustness of motion forecasting model via closed-loop reinforcement learning fine-tuning.
highlights: Designed large motion forecasting architectures that reduce catastrophic forgetting during RL fine-tuning for safety-critical autonomous planning.
Built a JAX-based closed-loop simulator with procedural OOD scenario generation, enabling scalable and closed-loop RLFT under distribution shift.

work.name: Vulcan Augmetics
work.summary: Developing robust human–machine interfaces through embedded biosignal learning and real-time intent decoding on edge devices.
highlights: Led R&D of embedded bio-signal systems for real-time muscle activity decoding, integrating signal processing and machine learning on edge devices.
Designed learning pipelines for EMG-based intent recognition with low-latency inference under hardware constraints.
Advised on end-to-end system design spanning sensors, embedded firmware, and user-facing mobile applications.

work.name: Bosch
work.summary: Building backend, monitoring, and IoT data interfaces for an agricultural disease prediction system.
highlights: Developed an OCR-based pipeline for automated SIM card serial number recognition in manufacturing workflows.
Built a real-time sensor monitoring and reporting system managing over 2,000 sensors with automated fault detection.
Implemented REST-based data crawler with DFS for data collection and processing.

work.name: Aubot
work.summary: Developing embedded control and firmware systems for teleoperated mobile manipulators.
highlights: Developed and deployed control stack for an 8-DOF robotic arm and omnidirectional mobile base with obstacle detection and collision avoidance.
Implemented sensor-driven motion control and teleoperation for a telepresence robot.

work.name: National Instruments
work.summary: Prototyping and validating robotic control systems using industrial instrumentation and rapid development platforms.
highlights: Prototyped a self-balancing robot and a 3-DOF robotic arm using NI products.
Support clients’ projects using NI LabVIEW, Multisim, Ultiboard, and vision toolkits.

education.area: Electrical and Electronics Engineering (Honours First Class)

awards.title: First Year Fellowship in Natural Sciences and Engineering

publications.name: Gameplay filters: Robust zero-shot safety through adversarial imagination
publications.summary: Introduces Gameplay Filters, a safety framework that leverages adversarial imagination to anticipate and mitigate unsafe behaviors at deployment time, enabling robust zero-shot safety for reinforcement learning policies.

publications.name: Isaacs: Iterative soft adversarial actor-critic for safety
publications.publisher: 5th Annual Learning for Dynamics and Control Conference (L4DC 2023)
publications.summary: Presents ISAACS, an adversarial actor-critic algorithm that models safety as a soft minimax game between control and disturbance policies, enabling stable learning of safety-aware behaviors in continuous control settings.

publications.name: Provably optimal reinforcement learning under safety filtering
publications.publisher: The International Association for Safe & Ethical AI (IASEAI 2026)
publications.summary: Develops a theoretical framework establishing optimality guarantees for reinforcement learning under safety filters, showing that appropriately designed filters can enforce safety without sacrificing asymptotic performance.

publications.name: Sim-to-lab-to-real: Safe reinforcement learning with shielding and generalization guarantees
publications.summary: Introduces a sim-to-lab-to-real reinforcement learning framework that integrates safety shielding with formal generalization guarantees, enabling safe transfer of learned policies from simulation to real robotic systems.

publications.name: From refusal to recovery: A control-theoretic approach to generative AI guardrails
publications.publisher: The International Association for Safe & Ethical AI (IASEAI 2026)
publications.summary: Proposes a control-theoretic framework for generative AI guardrails that moves beyond static refusal, enabling recovery and safe continuation through dynamic constraints and feedback-based interventions.

publications.name: Back to the future: Efficient, time-consistent solutions in reach-avoid games
publications.publisher: 2022 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)
publications.summary: Develops efficient and time-consistent solution methods for reach-avoid differential games, addressing fundamental challenges in safety-critical planning and scalable robotic decision-making.

publications.name: MAGICS: Adversarial RL with minimax actors guided by implicit critic Stackelberg structure
publications.publisher: Workshop on the Algorithmic Foundations of Robotics (WAFR 2024)
publications.summary: Presents an adversarial reinforcement learning algorithm that leverages a Stackelberg game structure with implicit critics, yielding stable and convergent training for safety-oriented robot control policies.

publications.name: A hybrid indoor localization system running ensemble machine learning
publications.summary: Introduces a hybrid indoor localization system that combines sensor fusion with ensemble machine learning techniques to improve robustness and accuracy in complex indoor environments.

references.name: Jaime Fernández Fisac

projects.name: DARPA Learning Introspective Control (LINC) program
projects.summary: Developed introspective safety mechanisms for adaptive robot control under uncertainty, field-tested on a hybrid track-based robot and crane robot

projects.name: Robust learning-based safety filter on quadruped robot for locomotion
projects.summary: Developed zero-shot safety filter using adversarial imagination, deployed on a quadruped robot to prevent falls and unsafe actions during locomotion.
